clinical_study.official_title: POLARx Cardiac Cryoablation System Post Market Clinical Follow-up Study

brief_summary.textblock: This is a Post Market Clinical Follow-up (PMCF) study designed to establish the continued safety and effectiveness profile of the Boston Scientific Cardiac Cryoablation System after receiving CE mark.

detailed_description.textblock: The study will provide information on real-world usage of the Boston Scientific Cardiac Cryoablation System when used to perform pulmonary vein isolation (PVI) for the ablation treatment of atrial fibrillation (AF), according to the current and future guidelines and product indications for use. This may include but not limited to: repeated ablations to treat AF, concomitant or delayed adjunctive ablation strategies with other products and use of different diagnostic products to validate the results such as 3D mapping systems.

primary_outcome.description: freedom from procedure or device related adverse events after intervention

includes freedom from failure of intervention or more than one repeated procedures within 90 days post index procedure, or documented atrial fibrillation, new onset atrial flutter or atrial tachycardia between 91 days and 365 days post procedure

arm_group.description: Subjects indicated for the treatment of AF with the cryoablation system according to current and future Guidelines and system indications for use

intervention.description: cryoablation of atrial fibrillation consisting in electrical isolation of the pulmonary veins

study_pop.textblock: patients indicated for the treatment of AF with isolation of pulmonary veins technique according to current and future Guidelines and system indications for use
